Join us for a discussion with Todd Miller on his book "Storming the Wall: Climate Change, Migration, and Homeland Security."
  

Dear ##first_name[Supporter]##,

Droughts, fires, and floods are driving larger numbers of people to cross national borders. At the same time, highly militarized border armies are being deployed to stop them.

This week, author and journalist Todd Miller is coming to Vermont to talk about his book "Storming the Wall: Climate Change, Migration and Homeland Security."

Tuesday, November 7, 5:30 p.m.
Unitarian Church Of Montpelier
130 Main St.
Montpelier, VT 05602

Wednesday, November 8, 3:30 p.m.
School for International Training (SIT)
1 Kipling Rd.
Brattleboro, VT 05301

Visit the event page on Facebook for more details and to RSVP.

The ACLU of Vermont joins 350 Vermont, the Unitarian Church of Montpelier, and Migrant Justice in sponsoring these important conversations about the flashpoint where our militarized borders meet refugees in crisis. "Storming the Wall" makes the case for both international solidarity and ecological restoration, not border militarization, as the best way to achieve sustainability and security.

Sincerely,

ACLU of Vermont
